messages.message:
Hi team,
I’m trying to run the model-service on Docker, but it keeps failing with the following error. Can someone help? I’ve retried multiple times with the latest image, but it didn’t resolve the issue.

```2024-06-06 10:06:24 level=INFO time=2024-06-06 17:06:24,747 msg="Rebuild model metadata from local dir /tmp/models/tmp0q53lj25"  path="/model-service/py/instabase/model_service/model_registry.py:912" process="MainProcess" thread="MainThread" trace_id=""
2024-06-06 10:06:24 Traceback (most recent call last):
2024-06-06 10:06:24   File "/model-service/py/server.py", line 249, in <module>
2024-06-06 10:06:24     serve()
2024-06-06 10:06:24   File "/model-service/py/server.py", line 209, in serve
2024-06-06 10:06:24     model_cache = _get_model_cache()
2024-06-06 10:06:24   File "/model-service/py/server.py", line 174, in _get_model_cache
2024-06-06 10:06:24     ) if app_config.ENABLE_MODEL_STORE else LocalModelRegistry()
2024-06-06 10:06:24   File "/model-service/py/instabase/model_service/model_registry.py", line 778, in __init__
2024-06-06 10:06:24     self._rebuild_model_metadata_from_disk()
2024-06-06 10:06:24   File "/model-service/py/instabase/model_service/model_registry.py", line 930, in _rebuild_model_metadata_from_disk
2024-06-06 10:06:24     model = _get_model_spec_from_disk(model_dir=dir)
2024-06-06 10:06:24   File "/model-service/py/instabase/model_service/model_registry.py", line 490, in _get_model_spec_from_disk
2024-06-06 10:06:24     raise RuntimeError(f'Model {model_dir} does not have {MODEL_PACKAGE_FILE}')
2024-06-06 10:06:24 RuntimeError: Model /tmp/models/tmp0q53lj25 does not have package.json
2024-06-06 10:06:24 level=INFO time=2024-06-06 17:06:24,751 msg="Stopping periodic export of AuditLogsExporter"  path="/model-service/py/instabase/exporter/exporter.py:54" process="MainProcess" thread="MainThread" trace_id=""```
did you try clearing the model cache? ie try removing `/tmp/models`?
That works! Thank you so much :tada:
